p: The P. lentiscus EO composition was dominated by monoterpene hydrocarbons, which accounted for more than 90% of the totality of identified compounds: α-pinene, in particular, was the most abundant compound in the EO, representing over 65% of the total. Among this chemical class, myrcene and β-pinene followed, showing relative abundances of 16.4% and 4.9%, respectively. Regarding the other compounds, only limonene, β-caryophyllene, camphene, o-methyl anisole, and trans-verbenol showed a relative content over 1.0%.
